Sports and Clubs: Member (i) Nizam Club; (ii) Country Club; and (iii) Constitution Club
Social And Cultural Activities: Actively Participated in various social, educational and cultural activities; toured through the State of Andhra Pradesh with Shri N.T.R. and A.N.R. for collecting cyclone relief fund for the Deviseema calamity, 1997; organised and participated in Star Nights and contributed the proceeds to the Mother Teresa Cancer Institute and Punjab Police Welfare Fund; established Jayaprada Charitable Trust which has organised eye camps, eye banks, blood donation camps, ortho camps, providing blankets to poor, handicapped and destitute people and arranging group marriages, etc. for the welfare of society; establish Jayaprada Educational Society and Neelaveni Krishna (N.K.) School of Nursing and opening Jayaprada College of Law for the poor student, Rampur
Profession: Film Artist Fim Producer Distributor Social Worker
Literary Artistic & Scientific Accomplis: Historical subject Amrapali is most appreciated ballet of her stage performances;learned classical Kuchipudi and Bharatanatyam Dances; recipient of (i) Doctorate from Sri Venkateswara University (A.P.); (ii) Rajiv Gandhi Award; (iii) Filmfare Award (four times); (iv) Lifetime Achievement Award, 2008; (v) Kala Saraswati Award; (vi) Nargis Dutt Gold Medal;(vii) Kinnera Savitri Award, (viii) Shakuntala Kala Rathnam Award; (ix) Ugadi Puraskar, Chennai; (x) Mahila Shaurya Samman; (xi)Uttam Kumar Award; and (xii) Shiromani Award
Special Interests: To do charity work through her Charitable Trust for upliftment of poor, sick, handicapped, victimized and destitute people
Educational Qualifications: B.A. Educated at Rajalaxmi Women`s College, Rajahmundry, Andhra Pradesh
Other Information: A versatile actress, producer, director and exhibitor; started her film career that spanned over two decades and acted in more than 280 films in different languages viz. Telugu, Hindi, Kannada, Bengali, Tamil, Malayalam and Marathi; actively involved in the field of Production and Distribution of Films; produced Bengali film `Shesh Sanghat` ; inspired by the movement of NTR, joined politics in 1994 and since then actively working for social welfare.
Name: Nahata,Smt. P. Jaya Prada
Positions Held:
1996-2002
Member, Rajya Sabha

1996-97
Member, Committee on Industry
Member, Committee on External Affairs
Member, Committe on the Welfare of Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes
Member, Consultative Committee, Ministry of Information and Broadcasting

2004
Elected to 14th Lok Sabha

2004-09
Member, Committee on Information Technology
Member, Committee on Empowerment of Women
Member,Parliamentary Forum on Water Conservation & Management

2009
Re-elected to 15th Lok Sabha (2nd term)

31 Aug. 2009
Member, Committee on Finance
